item.title: The same as 8370225., 19th November

item.title: Woodland path litter, 19th November
item.description:
Woodland path alongside Aldi full of litter. Area constantly neglected by RBG. No bins or care given to the area. Please clean this area as it’s used by wildlife , cyclists, wheelchairs and buggies riding through glass and rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Park Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned caravan still there almost two months later, 19th November
item.description:
Why is this caravan still here? It's been nearly two months since a notice was stuck to it saying it would be 'removed in 7 days'.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Auckland Road, South Norwood, London Borough of Croydon

item.title: More flytipping - grass this time, 19th November
item.description:
Another week another thing dumped in the same spot. This time it's grass clippings, dumped into the gutter. With the unfixed water main uphill and the freezing weather coming this could work out pretty badly if it isn't sorted quickly. Can you PLEASE step up your activity in this area? Some form of monitoring is becoming essential. It is clearly now seen as a 'safe' location for people to dump their things without fear of getting caught.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Auckland Road, South Norwood, London Borough of Croydon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subject: Urgent Complaint – Vehicles Blocking Emergency Exit and Access to Homes, 19th November
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious safety concern regarding vehicles repeatedly parking in a way that blocks the emergency exit and obstructs access for many households in the area. This has created an extremely dangerous situation, especially if emergency services ever need to enter or residents need to exit quickly. The individuals parking there are fully aware that the Council and Parking Enforcement are not issuing tickets in this specific spot, and they are taking advantage of this loophole. As a result, they continue to abuse the system, causing ongoing obstruction and frustration for residents. I respectfully request urgent action to address this issue. Clear enforcement, signage, or physical measures may be needed to prevent unsafe parking and ensure the emergency exit remains unobstructed at all times. Thank you for your prompt attention. I look forward to your response and a practical solution to this ongoing problem. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxley Close, Old Kent Road, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
